page.title: 07MEMORIES
page.content: I have lived in Porthoustock for more years than any other resident (45 years). My father worked at the now disused St. Keverne Quarry which is where two of my three sons and myself worked until we were made redundant 10 years ago. I got a job at Dean Quarry but one of my sons moved to Penzance and the other to London. I have 5 children and met my wife when she worked here in the Land Army during the War. I had the chance to move to Plymouth with a job and a house provided but I would not go. When the life boat was taken away 40 years ago the life boat house became a social centre for concerts and village meetings. It is empty now. It is essential to have a car if you live here. As boys we often used to get a lift on a quarry lorry to school.
